Summary Software Development Engineer with 3 years of experience in designing, developing and delivering platform independent solutions and performance optimized tools and frameworks, and working in a short-cycle, agile, iterative development team. 
 
With a strong foundation in computer science concepts at USC in addition to hands on experience in software development through Intel work experience, academic projects, internships and a couple of entrepreneurial endeavors, my learning curve has been huge. I want to be a part of projects where I can make a significant contribution to the company and helps me grow my passion for technology. Experience Associate Software Engineer Salesforce February 2015  – Present (7 months) San Francisco Bay Area Strategic Analyst Software Engineering Intern Intel Corporation June 2014  –  August 2014  (3 months) Santa Clara, California > Focused on identifying business client and Line of business enabling requirements for core based platform along with segment analysis 
> Played a key role in enabling certain features of the client's requirements on the Core platform for Desktops and servers. Data Analyst University of Southern California September 2013  –  May 2014  (9 months) Collect, manage, analyze and maintain Student's data in a central database. Send reports to the management for their inputs and feedbacks. Software Engineer Intel Corporation December 2010  –  July 2013  (2 years 8 months) •	Designed and developed a generalized reusable framework in C++ that takes care of test automation and uploads test results from different test environments to a central database and deployed it in various server and client projects. The tool ensured that the previously modular, Windows-specific validation solution now supported multiple file formats in both Windows and Linux and reduced data upload time from many hours to a few minutes.  
•	Received the Spontaneous Recognition Award for identifying and validating a major firmware issue in the Phone Sensor Protocol through content development tests in C. The system level, unit and API tests revealed memory cache leak and identified the root cause thus saving the cost of an additional production cycle of the processor.  
•	As an individual contributor, I developed and deployed Intel's first automated debug and coverage solution for SoC validation on Android - Jellybean. The objective was to automate the manual process of setting up the environment and running tests, thus validating the CPU performance and providing feedback for further analysis by the design engineers. I received Department recognition award from a senior principle engineer for delivering the solution with excellence. Software Engineering Intern Intel Corporation December 2010  –  June 2011  (7 months) Bengaluru Area, India > Developed a tool in Python that performs intelligent classification and bucketing of failures, based on signatures, that occur while running functional tests in a fabricated system.The tool reduced the processing and debugging time by 70%. 
 
> Developed a C# library that provided APIs to convert raw test failure data to analysis data. 
 
> Developed a regression framework that runs nightly regressions and performs analysis of data by comparing the golden test results with the regression results. The framework also included the feature of email delivery, reporting the test status and its results. Summary Actively seeking full time opportunities in the field of software development/engineering. 
 
I enjoy working in the fields of Big Data Analytics, Cloud Computing, Statistics, AI, and Machine Learning areas coupled with Object oriented design. 
 
Love to work in a team involved in developing or testing software and contribute to the growth of the organization in the best way possible by using my knowledge and skills. 
 
Currently pursuing Masters degree in Computer Science at University of Texas, Dallas with a specialization in Data Science. 
 
I have an international paper published in an IEEE journal. The paper talks about the creation of virtual vocational training scenario for a fabric painting application. 
 
Few academic projects in which I was involved: 
•	Artificial Intelligence, Summer 2014: Implementation of Chess Engine using Python. 
•	Database Design, Fall 2013: Implementation of B+ Tree indexing on a text file with variable key length using Java. 
•	Semantic Web, Fall 2013: Visualization of trends in petroleum imports and prices in USA. Technology used: RDF, SPARQL, JavaScript, HTML. 
•	Undergraduate Trainee in Electronics and Radar Development Establishment (LRDE). Developed a Web based Built-in-Test Display for RADAR Systems, using Java which prioritizing component status messages from mission critical RADAR systems through a secured wireless network thereby increasing overall performance. 
•	Virtual Fabric Paint Environment using Touch and Gesture technology for Vocational Training, sponsored by Government of India. Tools Used: Visual C# 2008, Microsoft Tablet PC SDK 1.7. 
 
I worked as a Technology Consultant - I for Hewlett Packard Globalsoft Ltd, Bangalore. My daily duties consisted of translating user requirements into well designed Web applications. I dabbled with front-end, middleware, and back-end code and improved the design of the client applications thereby decreasing manual intervention. Experience Undergrad Software Engineering Intern Intel Corporation June 2015  – Present (3 months) Folsom, California Utilizing the robust programming language of Python, and more specifically, the PyVisa library, I am automating several engineering tools(oscilloscope, network analyzer, external power supply). Through enabling the automation of these tools, I have saved many hours of, what would be, in-person debugging on computer memory technologies. 
 
I am also in charge of low power DDR3 and DDR4 memory test execution, as well as automating the validation and failure characterization of those devices. The automation is done via a Python program which parses the log file and organizes the data in a logical and easy to understand matter. The program then produces a very readable excel report. Web Developer Intern Field Squared January 2015  –  April 2015  (4 months) Denver, CO At Field Squared I worked on the Web App aspect of their product, fixing bugs and defects, and also implementing requested features. 
 
While working here, I am contributed many client side AngularJS (JavaScript), HTML and CSS bug fixes in a fast paced development environment. Undergraduate Software Engineering Intern Intel Corporation May 2014  –  December 2014  (8 months) Folsom, CA I worked in Test and Validation for PMO(Platform Memory Operations). PMO works with memory suppliers to help test, develop, and validate computer memory.  
 
While at Intel: 
 
• Conducted functional and environmental tests on Dynamic Random-Access 
Memory (DRAM) chips, in Platform Memory Operations. 
• Automated validation processes by developing Python scripts, reducing task 
time from 3 hours to 0 hours per chip. 
• Developed test flow code that helps test and debug DRAM chips, using C/C++. 
• Enabled remote control over environmental testing through a GPIB cable, and 
worked on a C program that allowed for scripting the temperature changes. Software Engineering Undergraduate Intern Rockwell Collins August 2011  –  March 2014  (2 years 8 months) Cedar Rapids, Iowa Area At Rockwell Collins I started out in the high school internship program. It was a select program that gave Juniors and Seniors in highschoolers a chance to intern with several groups at Rockwell. After I graduated high school my position changed to a software engineering undergrad intern. Between the various groups i interned with, I learned a lot of technical and soft skills. 
 
Some achievements are: 
• Obtained a United States Government security clearance in order to 
automate classified XML data retrieval and testing, using Java. 
• Helped to create a streamlined Linux development environment that nearly 
eliminated the lengthy process of setting up a working environment for the 
target hardware. 
• Wrote a front-end in Java for the UCC (Unified Code Count) tool, which 
helped to drastically reduce user interaction time amongst team members. 
• Wrote Python scripts that simulated communication between a Rockwell 
Collins product and an airport’s ground control which helped release the 
product within its intended schedule. 
• Participant of a select high school internship program from 2011 to 2012.
